public final class GLRenderTarget extends GpuRenderTarget
Represents OpenGL render targets.

    • makeWrapped

      @Nonnull @SharedPtr public static GLRenderTarget makeWrapped(GLDevice device, int width, int height, int format, int sampleCount, int framebuffer, int stencilBits, boolean ownership)
      Make a GLRenderTarget that wraps existing framebuffers without accessing their backing buffers (texture and stencil).
      Parameters:
      width - the effective width of framebuffer
      height - the effective height of framebuffer

    • bindStencil

      public void bindStencil()
      Make sure the stencil attachment is valid. Even though a color buffer op doesn't use stencil, our FBO still needs to be "framebuffer complete". If this render target is already bound, this method ensures the stencil attachment is valid (attached or detached), if stencil buffers reset right before.

    • asTexture

      public GLTexture asTexture()
      Description copied from interface: IGpuSurface
      If this object is texture, returns this.

      If this object is framebuffer, returns the associated color buffer 0 if available, or null (only OpenGL can return null).

      Specified by:
      asTexture in interface IGpuSurface
      Specified by:
      asTexture in class GpuRenderTarget
      Returns:
      raw ptr to the texture

      Returns:

    • attachStencilBuffer

      protected void attachStencilBuffer(@SharedPtr Attachment stencilBuffer)
      Description copied from class: GpuRenderTarget
      Allows the backends to perform any additional work that is required for attaching an Attachment. When this is called, the Attachment has already been put onto the RenderTarget. This method must return false if any failures occur when completing the stencil attachment.
      Specified by:
      attachStencilBuffer in class GpuRenderTarget
      See Also:
      • ResourceProvider
